title: irukandji
author: irukandji
content: When was the bitcoin white paper first published on bitcoin dot org ?Was it published elsewhere also?

comments.author: albert0bsd
comments.body: 2008-10-31 Was the date of the first email of satoshi, there you can see at the end that the paper was abiable since that date.QuoteFull paper at:http://www.bitcoin.org/bitcoin.pdfSatoshi Nakamotohttps://www.metzdowd.com/pipermail/cryptography/2008-October/014810.htmlhttps://satoshi.nakamotoinstitute.org/emails/cryptography/1/

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: irukandji on September 25, 2023, 03:21:54 AMWhen was the bitcoin white paper first published on bitcoin dot org ?Was it published elsewhere also?Do you mean before 2008, or the sites host it after that, or now?After this message and in February 2009 the first talking about it in the P2P Foundation forum by Satoshi with a post titled “I’ve developed a new open source P2P e-cash system called Bitcoin.” I remember that the name was discussed in emails between him and Sirius, a.k.a. Martti Malmi

comments.author: Samfarrell
comments.created_time: September 25, 2023, 07:23:06 AMLast edit: September 26, 2023, 04:42:10 AM by Samfarrell
comments.body: Quote from: irukandji on September 25, 2023, 03:21:54 AMWhen was the bitcoin white paper first published on bitcoin dot org ?Was it published elsewhere also? UTSA BlackboardThe Bitcoin white paper was first published on bitcoin.org on October 31, 2008. And it was not published elsewhere initially.

comments.author: AprilioMP
comments.body: Quote from: irukandji on September 25, 2023, 03:21:54 AMWhen was the bitcoin white paper first published on bitcoin dot org ?Was it published elsewhere also?Sorry sir if I give myself to ask you back. Is it because of the NSA news about Satoshi's white paper that causes your question to appear here?https://cointelegraph.com/news/nic-carter-supports-bitcoin-invented-by-nsa-conspiracy-theoryYou have just woken up from being inactive for a long time, reappearing by creating this topic after last posting in 2021 on the Development & Technical Discussion board.According to your age, it is not appropriate for you to ask about the white paper when it was published because of your experience in the forum.

comments.author: gunhell16
comments.body: This is all the information I've got for you, dude.https://www.bitpanda.com/academy/en/lessons/the-bitcoin-whitepaper-simply-explained/https://bitflyer.com/en-eu/s/glossary/bitcoin-whitepaperThis whitepaper discusses Bitcoin core concepts and then executes a safe transaction, correct?According to what I know about the subject, this whitepaper was also designed to attract early adopters and developersAnd most importantly to shows it unique decentralization also, isn't?

comments.author: Peter3493
comments.body: The Bitcoin white paper, titled "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System," was first published on bitcoin.org by an individual or group
